body.p: To His Excellency Gov Jas. F. Robertson

We the undersigned, citizens of Trigg County, Kentucky, would state that at the last February term of the Trigg Circuit Court J. H. Wilkinson had a judgement rendered against him of $5000 for shooting at one John S. Spiceland. The circumstances are about these. Mr Spiceland is a young man about 27 years old weighs 220 or 30 pounds, and very stout. Mr Wilkinson is a feeble man compared with the other, 46 or 8 years old, and a remarkably peaceable man. M. Spiceland had charge of a newspaper in this place, and abused said Wilkinson in such a manner that he deemed that his reputation at least required something of a retaliation. Wilkinson therefore made a publication in the Hopkinsville paper reflecting on Spiceland. Spiceland met Wilkinson a short time thereafter in a room and made a violent assault on him with a club, wounding him considerably, and severly. Wilkinson saw him passing an hour or so afterwards and shot at him with a pistol without striking him. These are the facts, and the Com'th Atty seeing that it would be a hardship for Wilkinson to pay the fine under the circumstances has remitted his share of the fine and we ask your Excellency to remit the Commth portion.
